patterns: What documents are required to change the address of an entity
Entity address change documents
Changing address of an entity requirements
responses: Following documents are required to change the address of an entity:
- Request letter for address change signed by the Proprietor/Partner/Authorised Signatory (in case of a company)
Along with the following list of documents:
- Landline telephone bill/electricity bill of public and approved private operators in the State. (Bills not to be older than 4 months from the date of account opening)
- Property Ownership Deed i.e. the title deeds of the property in the name of the firm duly stamped and registered
- TAN Allotment Letter issued in the name of the firm
- Latest property tax or water tax paid receipt/bill raised in the name of the firm

** This is only an indicative list. Please visit your nearest branch for details.

responses: Following documents are required for opening Current Account of a company:
Private Limited Companies -
- Memorandum of Association (MOA)
- Articles of Association (AOA)
- Certificate of Incorporation
- Latest list of directors duly signed by any Director/Company Secretary/Authorised Signatory

Limited Companies -

- Articles of Association (AOA)
- Certificate of Incorporation
- Certificate of Commencement of Business

patterns: What is the time taken to realize outstation cheques
Outstation cheques realization time
Processing time for outstation cheques
responses: The indicative time taken for the realization of outstation cheques is given below:
Cheques drawn where M&N Bank has a branch, credit will be given on receipt of clear funds in:
- Main metro locations (Mumbai, Chennai, Kolkata, New Delhi): 7 working days
- Metro centers and state capitals (other than those of North Eastern states and Sikkim): Maximum period of 10 working days.
- In all other centers where we have branches: maximum period of 14 working days.
Cheques drawn on non-branch locations where we have a tie-up with correspondent banks, credit will be given on receipt of clear funds:
- Within a maximum period of 14 working days.
Cheques drawn on non-branch locations where we do not have a tie-up with correspondent banks, credit will be given on receipt of clear funds:
- Within a maximum period of 14 working days.
For more details on the outstation cheque collection policy, [click here](link).
For other queries, [Contact Us](contact-link).

patterns: What are the documents required for opening a Current Account of a partnership firm
Documents for partnership firm Current Account
Partnership firm Current Account opening requirements
responses: Following documents are required for opening a Current Account of a partnership firm:
- Latest Partnership Deed
- Documents establishing proof of existence:
- Certificate of Registration under any Statute/Act or professional bodies
- Registration Certificate issued by Registrar of Firms
- Valid Business License or Certificate of Registration issued by State/Central Government authority (validity would include the grace period for renewal as mentioned in the certificate)
- PAN Card in the name of the firm;
- Self-signed cheque issued from the firm’s account from a PSU/private sector/foreign bank along with a bank statement not older than four months
- Documents for establishing proof of address:
- Landline telephone bill/electricity bill of public and approved private operators in the State. (Bills not to be older than 4 months from the date of account opening)
- Property Ownership Deed i.e. title deeds of the property in the name of the firm duly stamped and registered
- Latest property tax or water tax paid receipt/bill raised in the name of the firm
- TAN Allotment Letter in the name of the firm
- Existing bank account statement or passbook of a PSU/private sector/foreign bank - Statement not older than 4 months from the date of account opening to be accepted
- Documents for establishing photo identity of authorised partners/signatories

patterns: How is a Flexi Current account different from a regular current account
Differences between Flexi Current account and regular current account
Flexi Current account privileges
responses: The Flexi account includes the following privileges:

- Flexibility of higher cash deposits (home location) and transactions anywhere (payments, collections and funds transfers), limits during peak seasons, since these are based on the Average Monthly Balance (AMB) maintained in the account.

- Calculation of free transaction limits based on balances maintained in the transaction month, leading to a high level of customization in tune with current business requirements. For example, if your season starts in November, you get a transaction limit based on the balance maintained by you in November, and not in October or September.
- Low minimum balance requirement of Rs. 75,000 per month.
- Competitive pricing on and faster Collection of Outstation Cheques.
- Up to 40 free Pay Orders and 40 free Demand Drafts per month.
- Free RTGS and NEFT Transactions.
These privileges make a Flexi Current account different from a Regular Current account.

patterns: How much cash can I deposit per month in my home branch, without being charged
Free cash deposit limit at home branch
Cash deposit limit without charges at home branch
responses: The free cash deposit limit at your home branch depends on the AMB you have maintained during the transaction month.
This free limit is calculated as 10 times the actual AMB maintained during the transaction month or 50 transactions per month, whichever is less.

In case you make more than 50 transactions or your cash deposits are more than 10 times your AMB at your home branch, you will have to pay a charge of Rs. 3 per Rs. 1,000, subject to a minimum of Rs. 50 (excluding taxes).

If I maintainI get Monthly Free If I utilizeI am Charged Average Monthly Balance (AMB) in Rs. Home Location Cash Deposit in Rs. (Subject to maximum of 50 transactions) Actual Home Location Cash Deposit in Rs. Rs. (excluding 12.36% Service Tax & Education Cess)
*The Home Location Cash Deposit Free limit is rounded off to the nearest thousand
** AMB non-maintenance charges

patterns: What are the permissible credits from an RFC Domestic Account

Permissible credits for RFC Domestic Account
responses: As per the RBI directive, the following can be credited into an RFC Domestic Account:
a) Received as pension or any other superannuation or other monetary benefits from his employer outside India;
b) Realised on conversion of the assets referred to in sub-section (4) of section 6 of the Act, and repatriated to India;
c) Received or acquired, as gift or inheritance, from a person referred to in sub-section (4) of section 6 of the Act; or
d) Referred to in clause (c) of section 9 of the Act, or acquired as gift or inheritance therefrom.

responses: Yes, the EEFC account balances can be hedged.

patterns: Is there any restriction on withdrawal in rupees of funds held in an EEFC account
EEFC account withdrawal in rupees
Restrictions on EEFC account withdrawal
responses: No, there is no restriction on withdrawal in rupees of funds held in an EEFC account. However, the amount withdrawn in rupees shall not be eligible for conversion into foreign currency and for re-credit to the account.

patterns: How much of foreign exchange earnings can be credited into an EEFC account
Crediting foreign exchange earnings to EEFC account
Limits on crediting foreign exchange to EEFC account
responses: 100% foreign exchange earnings can be credited to the EEFC account subject to the condition that the sum total of the accruals in the account during a calendar month should be converted into rupees on or before the last day of the succeeding calendar month after adjusting for utilization of the balances for approved purposes or forward commitments. Refer to the RBI circular on below link. Note: In accordance with Reserve Bank of India's circular no. A. P. (DIR Series) Circular No. 12 dated 31st of July 2012, the balances outstanding in all EEFC / Diamond Dollar Account (DDA) and RFC (D) accounts as on the last day of a Current month, shall be converted into Rupees by the Bank on the last working day of the succeeding month, if such balance is not utilized by the account holder before the last day of succeeding month. Such mandatory conversion by the bank on the last working day of the succeeding month will be done at the prevailing TT buying card rate. In case, customer has booked Forward Contract/s for conversion of balances in these accounts at a future date which is falling beyond the last day of the succeeding month, such contracted amount shall be deducted from the eligible amount for the mandatory conversion. In case customer has any payment to be made in the future from these accounts beyond the last day of the succeeding month then the bank should be duly informed before 25th of the succeeding month in writing through Relationship Manager / Branch Manager for holding back the conversion to that extent. The customer needs to submit the underlying documents of such future transaction/s. This will be an on-going procedure till we receive revised instructions from Reserve Bank of India.

patterns: What are the permissible credits into EEFC account
Permissible credits for EEFC account
Credits allowed in EEFC account
responses: Inward remittance through normal banking channels, other than remittances received on account of foreign currency loan or investment received from abroad or received for meeting specific obligations by the account holder;

Payments received in foreign exchange by a 100 per cent Export Oriented Unit or a unit in (a) Export Processing Zone or (b) Software Technology Park or (c) Electronic Hardware Technology Park for the supply of goods to similar such units or to a unit in a domestic tariff area;
Payments received in foreign exchange by a unit in the domestic tariff area for the supply of goods to a unit in the Special Economic Zone (SEZ);

Payment received by an exporter from an account maintained with an authorized dealer for the purpose of counter trade. (Counter trade is an arrangement involving the adjustment of the value of goods imported into India against the value of goods exported from India in terms of the Reserve Bank guidelines);
Advance remittance received by an exporter towards export of goods or services;
Professional earnings including director's fees, consultancy fees, lecture fees, honorarium, and similar other earnings received by a professional by rendering services in his individual capacity;
Re-credit of unutilized foreign currency earlier withdrawn from the account;
Amount representing repayment by the account holder's importer customer, of loan/advances granted, to the exporter holding such account; and

The disinvestment proceeds received by the resident account holder on the conversion of shares held by him to ADRs/GDRs under the Sponsored ADR/GDR Scheme approved by the Foreign Investment Promotion Board of the Government of India.

patterns: What are the permissible debits into this account
Permissible debits for EEFC account
Debits allowed in EEFC account
responses: Payment outside India towards a permissible current account transaction [in accordance with the provisions of the Foreign Exchange Management (Current Account Transactions) Rules, 2000] and permissible capital account transaction [in accordance with the Foreign Exchange Management (Permissible Capital Account Transactions) Regulations, 2000].

Payment in foreign exchange towards the cost of goods purchased from a 100 percent export-oriented unit or a unit in (a) Export Processing Zone or (b) Software Technology Park or (c) Electronic Hardware Technology Park.
Payment of customs duty in accordance with the provisions of the Foreign Trade Policy of the Central Government for the time being in force.

Trade-related loans/advances, extended by an exporter holding such account to his importer customer outside India, subject to compliance with the Foreign Exchange Management (Borrowing and Lending in Foreign Exchange) Regulations, 2000.
Payment in foreign exchange to a person resident in India for the supply of goods/services including payments for airfare and hotel expenditure.

patterns: Where can I get Fixed Deposit advice from

responses: You can now download Fixed Deposit advice through Netbanking in pdf format. patterns: How can I avail exemption from TDS on interest earned on Fixed Deposits
Exemption from TDS on Fixed Deposit interest
Avoiding TDS on Fixed Deposit interest
responses: To avail exemption from TDS on interest earned on Fixed Deposits, please submit a completed Form 15H (for Senior citizens) or Form 15G (for Regular customers) at any nearest M&N  Bank Branch (Form available on the website).

patterns: How can I prematurely liquidate my Fixed Deposits
Premature liquidation of Fixed Deposits
Liquidating Fixed Deposits in M&N Bank
responses: We request you to submit your Fixed Deposit advice, duly discharged by all account holders, at the nearest branch for premature liquidation of your fixed deposit. In the absence of your Fixed Deposit advice, you need to submit the attached Fixed Deposit Liquidation form. Visit a branch or call us You may visit the following URL to access information for the complete address and contact details of our Branches as well as our PhoneBanking numbers. NetBanking Alternatively, you can liquidate your Fixed Deposits through NetBanking. This facility is available to Fixed Deposits held under Sole Owner (SOW) relationship only. The following are the steps required to liquidate your Fixed Deposit online: Access your NetBanking account with your Customer ID and IPIN (NetBanking Password) Select the ‘Liquidate Fixed Deposit option under the Fixed Deposit menu from the Menu bar located on the left hand side of the web page Select the Fixed Deposit account number from the Drop-down lists Once complete, click on Continue and Confirm the details entered A new web page, confirming the Liquidating Fixed Deposit will be displayed. This facility is available on NetBanking only to customers having Account and Fixed Deposit in Sole Name Further, kindly note that: Fixed deposits booked through branch can also be liquidated on NetBanking provided the FD is held with Sole Owner Relationship Fixed Deposits in the name of Non-individuals are not allowed for liquidation through NetBanking. Additional Information - As per current policy of the bank on premature liquidation, the interest rate applicable for premature closure of deposits (all amounts) will be the lower of: The base rate for the original/contracted tenure for which the deposit has been booked OR The base rate applicable for the tenure for which the deposit has been in force with the Bank. # the base rate is the rate applicable to deposits of less than Rs.15 Lakhs as on the date of booking the deposit. Further to the Terms & Conditions of Fixed Deposit Accounts of the Bank, the penalty on premature closure of Fixed Deposits including sweep-in and partial closures has been fixed by the Bank at the rate of 1%. This is applicable for all deposits booked on or after 24th January 2011. View less

patterns: How to Download TDS Certificate through Online
Downloading TDS Certificate online
TDS Certificate download process
responses: Please note you can now download the TDS certificate from Netbanking Accounts Module, Go to Request section click on TDS Inquiry. We request you to follow the below-mentioned process: Log in into NetBanking through the Customer ID and NetBanking Password (IPIN). Select TDS Inquiry under the Request option on the left-hand pane. Select the Financial Year and Quarter for which the certificate is required. Click on Continue and confirm. Additional information:- Currently, TDS Certificate for the Quarter 1, Quarter 2, Quarter 3 AND Quarter 4 are available. TDS certificates will be available only if PAN is updated and there is a tax deduction in the financial quarter. TDS certificate will be in PDF Format. View more

patterns: How to change existing fixed deposit account tenure
responses: We regret to inform you that tenure selected for the fixed deposit account cannot be changed once the account is opened. In this case we suggest that you can close your existing fixed deposit account and open a new account with a desired tenure.

patterns: How is TDS deducted
responses: Check the deduction rates below: Tax Rate Surcharge Education Cess TOTAL Resident Individuals & HUF 10% ---- ---- 10% Corporate Entity 10% ---- ---- 10% NRO 30% ---- 3% 30.90% Firms 10% ---- ---- 10% Co-operative Societies & Local Authority 10% ---- ---- 10% View more

patterns: Can TDS be recovered from my principle of the FD
responses: If the interest amount is not sufficient to recover TDS, the amount is taken from the principal of the deposit.

patterns: When does the Bank issue a TDS Certificate
responses: The TDS Certificate, Form 16A, for TDS deducted during a calendar quarter, will be issued in the next month of the respective quarter.

patterns: Can TDS influence the maturity of my deposit
responses: Yes, in case of reinvestment deposits, the interest reinvested is post TDS recovery & hence the maturity amount for re-investment deposits would vary to the extent of tax and compounding effect on tax for the period subsequent of deduction till maturity.

patterns: What are the implications of booking an FD without PAN
responses:
In the absence of PAN, following are the implications for customers:
- TDS will be recovered at 20% (as against 10%)
- NO TDS credit from the Income Tax department
- NO TDS certificate will be issued (As per CBDT circular no: 03/11)
- Form 15G/H and other exemption certificates will be invalid and penal TDS will apply View more

patterns: Will changes to my deposit portfolio affect my TDS liability
responses: Yes. If the change or enhancement in your deposit portfolio earns a cumulative interest along with that of the earlier portfolio greater than Rs. 10,000/- you will be liable for TDS on your current portfolio. Note: If interest on the current portfolio is not sufficient to cover TDS, it will be recovered from the principal.

patterns: When is TDS deducted for Regular Fixed Deposit
responses: TDS is deducted every time the Bank pays/re-invests interest during the Financial year. In addition, TDS is also deducted on interest accrued (but not yet paid) at the end of the financial year viz. 31st March.

patterns: What documents are required to open a senior citizen Regular Fixed Deposit
responses:
While opening the account, the customer needs to provide proof of age establishing that he/she is a Senior Citizen. To accomplish this, either of the following can be submitted:
- Secondary School Leaving Certificate (10th Class)
- LIC Policy
- Voters Identity Card
- Pension Payment Order
- Birth Certificate issued by the competent authority
- Passport
- Defence ID Card / Govt ID Card (Provided they have the cardholder's photo, signature and date of birth)
- PSU Issued ID Cards
- Senior Citizen Cards is ued by Indian Airlines / Indian Railways
- PAN Card View more

patterns: Can I open a joint account with a non-senior citizen for Regular Fixed Deposit
responses: You can, as long as the first account holder is a senior citizen.

patterns: As a Regular Fixed Deposit holder, How do I apply for an exemption on TDS
responses:
If your total interest income for the year does not fall within the overall taxable limits, you should let us know. You can do this by submitting a form as per the provisions of the Income Tax Act. A few things to note:
- You can get the 15AA form from the Assessing Officer of the Income Tax department.
- Even with the 15H/15AA form, the tax that has already been deducted by way of TDS during the year prior will not be refunded. However, you will get a certificate, which can be used while filing your tax return.
- 15H/15AA Forms are valid only for the financial year in which they are issued. A fresh 15G/H form needs to be completed for each deposit that is placed with the Bank, and it should be completed within the first week of the financial year. View more

patterns: How to prematurely liquidate the Fixed Deposit Online
responses:
You can liquidate your Fixed Deposits through NetBanking. This facility would be available to Fixed deposits held under Sole Owner (SOW) relationship only. Following are the steps for liquidating your Fixed Deposit online:
- Access your NetBanking account with your Customer ID and IPIN (NetBanking Password)
- Select Liquidate Fixed Deposit option under the Fixed Deposit menu from the Menu bar located on the left hand side of the web page
- Select the Fixed Deposit account number from the Drop-down lists
- Once complete, click on Continue and Confirm the details entered
- A new web page, confirming the Liquidating Fixed Deposit will be displayed.
Further, kindly note that:
- Fixed Deposits in the name of Non-individuals are not allowed for liquidation through NetBanking.
- Fixed deposit in the joint name cannot be liquidated online. View more

patterns: What is the new policy with regards to PAN to book fixed deposit with our bank
responses:
Where the total value of Fixed deposit per customer id <= 50,000( including the new FD being booked ) No PAN, & no form 60
Where the total value of fixed deposit per customer id > 50,000( including the new FD being booked) PAN required mandatorily

patterns: When do I become liable for TDS
responses: If the aggregate interest that you are likely to earn for all your deposits held across branches in a customer id is greater than Rs.10000 in a financial year, you become liable for TDS. Note: Tax liability for TDS purpose is determined basis per PAN no and not as per branch per PAN no. Deposits held by minors are also subject to TDS. The credit for the TDS can be claimed by the person in whose hands the minor's income is included.

patterns: What documents are required to open a senior citizen 5 Year Tax Saving Fixed Deposit
responses:
While opening the account, the customer needs to provide proof of age establishing that he/she is a Senior Citizen. To accomplish this, either of the following can be submitted:
- Secondary School Leaving Certificate (10th Class)
- LIC Policy
- Voters Identity Card
- Pension Payment Order
- Birth Certificate issued by the competent authority
- Passport
- Defence ID Card / Govt ID Card (Provided they have the cardholder's photo, signature and date of birth)
- PSU Issued ID Cards
- Senior Citizen Cards issued by Indian Airlines / Indian Railways
- PAN Card View more

patterns: Will the bank issue a TDS certificate
responses: You will receive a consolidated TDS Certificate in Form 16A, for TDS deducted during a financial year, in the month of April of the following financial year.

patterns: As a 5 Year Tax Saving Fixed Deposit holder, How do I apply for an exemption on TDS
responses:
If your total interest income for the year does not fall within the overall taxable limits, you should let us know. You can do this by submitting a form as per the provisions of the Income Tax Act. A few things to note:
- You can get the 15AA form from the Assessing Officer of the Income Tax department.
- Even with the 15G/15H form, the tax that has already been deducted by way of TDS during the year prior will not be refunded. However, you will get a certificate, which can be used while filing your tax return.
- 15H/15AA Forms are valid only for the financial year in which they are issued. A fresh Form - 15G/H needs to be submitted in the first week of the financial year for existing deposit and separately each time for subsequent deposit booked in the Financial Year. View more

patterns: When is TDS deducted for 5 Year Tax Saving Fixed Deposit
responses: TDS is deducted every time the Bank pays/re-invests interest during the Financial year. In addition TDS is also deducted on interest accrued (but not yet paid) at the end of financial year viz. 31st March.

patterns: Does any change or enhancement in my deposit portfolio affect TDS liability
responses: Yes. If the change or enhancement in your deposit portfolio earns a cumulative interest along with that of the earlier portfolio greater than Rs. 10,000/- you will be liable for TDS on your current portfolio. Note: If interest on the current portfolio is not sufficient to cover TDS, it will be recovered from the principal.

patterns: Do I need to visit branch to receive my 5 Year Tax Saving Fixed Deposit proceeds on maturity
responses: Customer is not required to visit the branch, FD proceeds will be credited to customer's account on maturity as per instructions.

patterns: Can I open a joint account with a non-senior citizen for 5 Year Tax Saving Fixed Deposit
responses: Yes, you can open a deposit with a non-senior citizen.

patterns: How to apply for 5 Year Tax Saving Fixed Deposit
responses: We request you to visit the nearest branch and fill the fixed deposit booking account opening form to open a 5 Year Tax Saving Fixed Deposit.

patterns: When am I liable for TDS (Tax Deduction at Source)
responses: You become liable for TDS (Tax Deduction at Source) if the aggregate interest that you’re likely to earn for all your deposits is greater than Rs. 10,000 in a financial year. TDS will be deducted when interest payable or reinvested on RD and FD per customer across all branches, exceed Rs.10000 in a financial year.

patterns: If I have a joint Super Saver Account, can both account holders get an ATM/Debit card
responses: Both account holders can get an ATM / Debit Card, but a maximum of two cards are given for each Super Saver Account.

patterns: Is the Super Saver Account a normal Savings Account
responses:
Look at the Super Saver Account as a Premium Savings account. With this option you’re combining the benefits of a Fixed Deposit and a Savings Account. There are a few other unique features, including:
- High interest rates
- A personalised cheque book
- A free ATM card
- Free inter-city access View more

patterns: What documents are required to open a senior citizen Super Saver Facility
responses:
While opening the account, the customer needs to provide proof of age establishing that he/she is a Senior Citizen. To accomplish this, either of the following can be submitted:
- Secondary School Leaving Certificate (10th Class)
- LIC Policy
- Voters Identity Card
- Pension Payment Order
- Birth Certificate issued by the competent authority
- Passport
- Defence ID Card / Govt ID Card (Provided they have the cardholder's photo, signature and date of birth)
- PSU Issued ID Cards
- Senior Citizen Cards issued by Indian Airlines / Indian Railways
- PAN Card View more

patterns: I’m part of a Trust – can I open a Super Saver Account
responses: Only Resident Individuals and Hindu Undivided Families are eligible to open a Super Saver Account.

patterns: Can I add on a Fixed Deposit
responses: You can, but it has to be in multiples of Rs 5,000. In this situation, the overdraft rate is recalculated. We will let you know the change. Separate add-on forms exist for adding the Fixed Deposit to the Super Saver Account.

patterns: Will TDS be charged on the gross interest earned or the net interest earned
responses: TDS (Tax Deducted at Source) is charged if, in a financial year, the gross interest earned on your fixed deposits held with the bank exceeds Rs. 10,000.

patterns: Can I have a Super Saver Facility and a Sweep-in Facility on the one Fixed Deposit
responses: This isn’t possible. You can only have one of these facilities on a single Fixed Deposit.

patterns: Can I have a Super Saver Facility and a Sweep-in Facility on the same Savings Account
responses: You can have both these facilities on the same Savings Account.

patterns: How can I apply for the Super Saver Account
responses:
You can apply for the Super Saver Account in the following ways:
- Apply through a branch: Submit a duly signed written instruction at the nearest branch.
- Apply by calling: Access information about our PhoneBanking numbers.
- Apply online: Follow the steps mentioned in your NetBanking account under 'Fixed Deposit Super Saver option.'
Please note various details and conditions apply for this facility.

patterns: Can a joint account be opened with a non-senior citizen
responses: Yes, as long as the first account holder is a senior citizen.

patterns: How does it work
responses: The Super Saver Account lets you withdraw up to 90% of your deposit without breaking it. You can withdraw cash through an ATM, by cheque, or via teller transactions.

patterns: Can I get an overdraft facility on my fixed deposit funds
responses: With our Super Saver Account, you can enjoy an overdraft facility of up to 90% of your Fixed Deposit funds without breaking the Fixed Deposit or losing interest on it. However, a minimum tenure of 6 months is required to open a Super Saver Fixed Deposit or avail of the Super Saver facility on your existing deposit.

patterns: What are the benefits
responses: With M&N Bank's Sweep-in facility, you gain high interest rates like a Fixed Deposit, along with the liquidity of a Savings Account. The Sweep-In facility links your deposits, and when there are insufficient funds in your account to clear a cheque, the bank breaks units of the deposit to cover the shortfall.

patterns: How can I apply for the Sweep-in facility
responses: To apply for the Sweep-In facility, log in to your NetBanking account and apply online. This facility is available for sole account holders (single owners) on NetBanking. Others can submit a request at the nearest branch. Note various conditions and restrictions apply for this facility.

patterns: Can I have both a Super Saver facility and a Sweep-In facility on the same Fixed Deposit
responses: No. You can only have one of the two facilities on a single Fixed Deposit.

patterns: Will both the principal and interest amount of my Fixed Deposit be considered
responses: Just the principle amount of your Fixed Deposit is considered.

patterns: Can I have a Super saver facility and a Sweep-in facility on the same Savings Account
responses: It is possible to have both these facilities on the same Savings Account. If there are insufficient funds in your Savings Account, your overdraft limit will be exhausted before units of the Sweep-In Fixed Deposits are used prematurely.

patterns: On what basis the Sweep-in facility gets triggered
responses: Effective 22nd Feb 2014, Sweep in of funds from your Fixed Deposit (FD) to Saving/ Current account will trigger on Last in First out basis (LIFO).

patterns: Can a Fixed Deposit be linked to two different Savings Accounts for the Sweep-in
responses: A Fixed Deposit can only be linked to one savings account for the Sweep-in facility.

patterns: Can my Sweep-in facility have multiple deposits
responses: You can definitely link more than one deposit to the Sweep-in facility. When you link more than one deposit to the facility, then the first deposit to be used will be the deposit which you opened last.

patterns: Can I link accounts held in different account titles to the same Savings Account for the Sweep-In facility
responses: No. You can only link the Sweep-In facility to the accounts with the same account title. For example, a Fixed Deposit held by A-B can be linked to a Savings Account held by A-B across branches.

patterns: What is the Sweep-in facility all about
responses: The Sweep-In facility is a cluster deposit (held in units of Re.1). We will automatically break units of term deposits held by you, if there are insufficient funds in your Sweep-In Savings/Current Account to clear a cheque. The same will happen when you wish to withdraw money using your ATM Card and there are insufficient funds in the account. For more information on the Sweep-In facility, please click here.

patterns: Is there a nomination facility
responses: Yes, there is a nomination facility on the Recurring Deposit account.

patterns: Is there a monthly or quarterly interest pay-out option
responses: Interest is paid when the Recurring Deposit account is closed, and on maturity.

patterns: Can I change the tenure and installment due date, (auto debit date) of my Recurring Deposit
responses: No, it is not possible to change the tenure and installment due date (auto debit date). We request you to open a new Recurring Deposit with the desired due date and tenure.

patterns: For what period can I open a Recurring Deposit
responses: You can open a Recurring Deposit account for a minimum period of 6 months, and thereafter in multiples of 3 months up to a maximum period of 10 years.

patterns: Can I choose my instalment date
responses: The date of your monthly RD installment will depend on the date you opened your RD account.

patterns: Can partial Payments be made on Recurring Deposits
responses: Partial payments are not possible.

patterns: What is the maximum deposit amount a Recurring Deposit account can be opened with
responses: The Maximum installment amount you can open a recurring Deposit account with is Rs 14,99,900/- per month.

patterns: What if certain RD installments are not paid
responses: If six consecutive installments are unpaid, the Bank reserves the right to close the RD account. The interest rate applicable on such closed accounts will be as per the premature withdrawal policy of the Bank.

patterns: How do Recurring Deposits work
responses: A monthly deposit of a pre-fixed amount is made in the Recurring Deposit account. On maturity, you get back the amount you deposited, along with interest calculated at the rate applicable at the time of opening your account.

patterns: Can I pay more than one instalment at a time
responses: You can, but note that there will be no interest paid on any additional amount deposited, other than the installment due.

patterns: How Interest Rate is calculated for premature withdrawal of Recurring Deposit
responses: If your Recurring Deposit is broken prematurely, the interest rate applicable for premature closure of deposits will be lower of The base rate for the original / contracted tenure for which the deposit has been booked OR The base rate applicable for the tenure for which the deposit has been in force with the Bank The base rate is the rate applicable to deposits of less than 1 crore as on the date of booking the deposit. In case of premature closure within a month, no interest shall be paid out & only principal amount shall be returned.

patterns: Is an overdraft facility allowed
responses: Right now there is no overdraft facility for Recurring Deposits.

patterns: How can I prematurely liquidate my recurring deposit
responses: If you wish to prematurely liquidate your Recurring Deposit, you can submit your Recurring Deposit advice or written instruction, duly signed by all account holders, at the branch for premature liquidation. Alternatively, you can liquidate your Recurring Deposits through NetBanking for Recurring Deposit held under Sole Owner (SOW) relationship. The interest rate applicable for premature closure of deposits will be based on the base rate for the original tenure or the tenure in force with the Bank, whichever is lower. In case of premature closure within a month, only the principal amount shall be returned.

patterns: What happens if I don’t pay an instalment
responses: If frequent defaults (non-payments) are observed in your payment of monthly installments, and six installments fall in arrears, the Bank reserves the right to close your RD account. The interest rate applicable on such accounts will be as per the premature withdrawal policy of the Bank.

patterns: Can my Recurring Deposit be opened in joint names
responses: Yes, you can open a Recurring Deposit in a joint name.

patterns: Can the first applicant for a Recurring Deposit be a minor
responses: The first applicant can be a minor.

patterns: Can I withdraw prematurely from my Recurring Deposit
responses: Premature withdrawals are allowed, but remember that no partial withdrawal is permitted.

patterns: I'm a senior citizen – are there any extra benefits
responses: You gain an additional 0.50% rate of interest.

patterns: How to open a Recurring Deposit
responses: Recurring Deposits can now be booked through NetBanking. Following are the steps for booking your Recurring Deposit online: Access your NetBanking account with your Customer ID and IPIN (NetBanking Password) Select Open Recurring Deposit option under the Recurring Deposit menu from the Menu bar located on the left hand side of the web page Select the desired values from the Drop-down lists Once complete, click on Continue and Confirm the details entered

patterns: Can you covert your existing saving account into a pension account
responses: Yes. You just have to submit an undertaking and submit the required documents.

patterns: Any minimum Balance need to be maintained in the account
responses: No minimum balance need to be maintained as these are Zero balance accounts.

patterns: When can we open pension accounts
responses: You can open pension account 6 months prior to your date of retirement.

patterns: Is nomination required in the account
responses: Nomination is mandatory in the account.

patterns: Can a pension account be opened jointly
responses: Pension account can be opened jointly with spouse only.

patterns: What are the charges for collection of outstation cheques
responses: To know the charges for collection of cheques levied in your account, click here to view the current schedule of charges. Kindly check under the following headings: Collection of outstation cheques - Our Bank Locations Collection of outstation cheques - Other Locations These charges attract a Service Tax and an Educational Cess as applicable in terms of the current Finance Bill.

patterns: What is the time taken to realize outstation cheques
responses: The indicative time taken for the realization of outstation cheques is given below: Cheques drawn where M&N Bank has a branch, credit will be given on receipt of clear funds in: Main metro locations (Mumbai, Chennai, Kolkata, New Delhi): 7 working days Metro centers and state capitals (other than those of North Eastern states and Sikkim): Maximum period of 10 working days. In all other centres where we have branches: maximum period of 14 working days. Cheques drawn on non-branch locations where we have a tie-up with correspondent banks, credit will be given on receipt of clear funds: Within a maximum period of 14 working days Cheques drawn on non-branch locations where we do not have a tie-up with correspondent banks, credit will be given on receipt of clear funds: Within a maximum period of 14 working days For more details on the outstation cheque collection policy, click here. For other queries, Contact Us.

patterns: How do I know my beneficiary's details for a cheque issued in my name (Basic Savings Bank Deposit Account - Farmers)
responses: To know your beneficiary's details for a cheque issued by you / issuer name for a cheque credited in your account, please contact any of our bank branches. You can refer the cheque deposit slip also for the details. To know about Service charges and fees click here. For more details, Contact Us.

patterns: How can I get an International Debit Card with my Basic Savings Bank Deposit Account - Farmers
responses: You can get an International Debit Card only on request at the branch @ Rs. 100 p.a. (plus applicable taxes) for each applicant.

patterns: What is the minimum balance required for an Apex Current account
Minimum balance in Apex Current account
Apex Current account maintenance balance
responses: You need to maintain an Average Quarterly Balance (AQB) of Rs. 10,00,000 in your Apex Current account.

patterns: What can I do with the NEFT facility
NEFT facility usage
Uses of NEFT
responses: You can use the NEFT facility to transfer funds from your M&N Bank account to an account in another Bank at the locations as specified by RBI.

patterns: Are all IVR based calls free
Free IVR based calls
Charges for IVR calls
responses: Yes, all IVR based PhoneBanking services are available free of cost. However, agent-assisted calls will be charged.

patterns: How do I apply for a Basic Savings Bank Deposit Account - Farmers with M&N Bank
Applying for Basic Savings Bank Deposit Account - Farmers
Procedure for BSBDA - Farmers application
responses: To apply for a Basic Savings Bank Deposit Account - Farmers with M&N Bank, you need to choose from the following:
1. Requesting a Bank representative to contact you. Fill in your details [here](contact-link) and our representative will get in touch with you shortly.
2. Download an application form. Once you have downloaded the form, you just need to follow the steps mentioned below:
- Print and fill in the application form.
- Attach the required documents. Click [here](documents-link) to see the documents required.
- Submit the documents at any of our branches. Click [here](branch-locator-link) to find a branch near you.
Please allow us a week's time to revert to your application.

patterns: How do I know my beneficiary's details for a cheque issued in my name (Kisan Club Savings account)
Beneficiary details for a cheque issued (Kisan Club Savings account)
Cheque issuer details (Kisan Club Savings account)
responses: To know your beneficiary's details for a cheque issued by you / issuer name for a cheque credited in your account, please contact any of our bank branches.
To know about service charges and fees click [here](service-charges-link).
For more details, [Contact Us](contact-link).

patterns: Is a nomination facility available for lockers
Locker nomination facility
Nomination for lockers
responses: Yes, a nomination facility is available to Individuals / Joint hirers of Safe Deposit Lockers.

patterns: What are the timings for locker operations
Locker operations timings
Locker access hours
responses: You can plan your visit and access your locker on all working days during banking hours.

patterns: How many nominees can be added to a single locker
Nominee limit for a locker
Adding nominees to a locker
responses: A nomination can be made in favour of only one individual.

patterns: Can I pay for the rent of a locker through my account
Locker rent payment through account
Paying locker rent from account
responses: Yes, you can set a Standing Instruction in your Account to pay your annual locker rent.

patterns: What is the procedure to add / cancel / modify a nominee in my locker
Locker nominee addition/cancellation/modification procedure
Adding/canceling/modifying locker nominee process
responses: You will need to fill up the following forms and submit them to your locker branch. The forms are available in the Forms centre section of our website:
- For addition of a nominee: Form SL1 (sole hirer) / SL1A (joint hirer)
- For cancellation of nomination: Form SL2
- For change of nomination: Form SL3 (sole hirer) / SL3A (joint hirer)
The branch will assist you after the form has been submitted by you.
For more details, [Contact Us](contact-link).

patterns: What are the tenure options
Tenure options for loans
Repayment tenure choices
responses: The choice is yours. You can choose from any of our repayment options - 12, 18, 24, 30, 36 or 48 months, all specially designed to suit your requirements.

patterns: When can I open a salary account with M&N Bank
Opening salary account with M&N Bank
Salary account eligibility
responses: The salary account can be opened by virtue of your employer / company having a Corporate Salary arrangement with the Bank.

patterns: I have not received the Welcome Letter and ATM/Debit Card PIN for my new account
Welcome Letter and PIN not received
New account Welcome Kit issues
responses: If you have not received the same at your mailing address within 7 days from the receipt of the Welcome Kit containing the Account deliverables, kindly [Contact Us](contact-link).

patterns: What is the time taken to realize outstation cheques
Realization time for outstation cheques
Cheque realization duration
responses: The indicative time taken for the realization of outstation cheques is given below:
- Cheques drawn where M&N Bank has a branch, credit will be given on receipt of clear funds in:
- Main metro locations (Mumbai, Chennai, Kolkata, New Delhi): 7 working days
- Metro centers and state capitals (other than those of North Eastern states and Sikkim): Maximum period of 10 working days.
- In all other centers where we have branches: Maximum period of 14 working days.
- Cheques drawn on non-branch locations where we have a tie-up with correspondent banks, credit will be given on receipt of clear funds: Within a maximum period of 14 working days
- Cheques drawn on non-branch locations where we do not have a tie-up with correspondent banks, credit will be given on receipt of clear funds: Within a maximum period of 14 working days
For more details on the outstation cheque collection policy, [click here](cheque-policy-link).
For other queries, [Contact Us](contact-link).

patterns: What to do if my Account becomes dormant
Dormant account activation process
Inactive account reactivation
responses: Due to non-operation for a period of 2 years, your account will become Dormant.
In order to activate your account, you are requested to:
- Submit a written instruction signed by all applicants along with ID proof and address proof at the branch where the account is held or at your nearest branch.
- Initiate credit or debit transaction at least once in a year to keep your account active.
For information on the complete address and contact details of our Branches as well as our PhoneBanking numbers, [Click Here](branch-contacts-link).

patterns: What are the documents required to open a salary account
Documents for salary account
Salary account opening requirements
responses: To open a Salary Account you have to:

patterns: What is the time taken to realize outstation cheques
Outstation cheque realization time
Cheque realization duration
responses: The indicative time taken for the realization of out-station cheques is given below:
- Cheques drawn where M&N Bank has a branch, credit will be given on receipt of clear funds in:
- Main metro locations (Mumbai, Chennai, Kolkata, New Delhi): 7 working days
- Metro centers and state capitals (other than those of North Eastern states and Sikkim): Maximum period of 10 working days.
- In all other centers where we have branches: maximum period of 14 working days.
- Cheques drawn on non-branch locations where we have a tie-up with a correspondent bank, credit will be given on receipt of clear funds: Within a maximum period of 14 working days
- Cheques drawn on non-branch locations where we do not have a tie-up with a correspondent bank, credit will be given on receipt of clear funds: Within a maximum period of 14 working days
[For more details on the outstation cheque collection policy, click here](cheque-policy-link)
For other queries, [Contact Us](contact-link)

patterns: How can I stop a cheque payment
Stop payment of cheque procedure
Cheque payment stoppage process
responses: To make a Stop Payment request on an issued Cheque, kindly follow the steps mentioned below:
- Log in to your NetBanking account
- Click on the Stop Payment of Cheque option available under Request menu on the left-hand side of the web page
- Select the Account Number (if more than 1 account)
- Enter first/Start cheque number to the last/End cheque number, with a reason for stopping the payment.
- Click on Continue.
- On the next web page, you can verify and click on Confirm tab to confirm the stop payment request.
To make a stop payment request on a single cheque, enter the same number in both the fields provided.
Stop payment of cheques through NetBanking is free of charge.
You may obtain the cheque series from PhoneBanking and then use NetBanking to stop the cheques.
Alternatively, you could use PhoneBanking or the branch to make a Stop Payment request for a cheque.
[Read more about fees and charges applicable to stop cheques here.](fees-and-charges-link)
These charges attract a Service Tax and an Educational Cess as applicable in terms with the current Finance Bill.

patterns: What are the eligibility criteria for Personal Accident Death Cover
Eligibility criteria for Personal Accident Death Cover
Personal Accident Death Cover eligibility
responses: Eligibility:
The following are the broad Terms & Conditions of the captioned cover on a salary account and Titanium Royale Debit card
- Accidental Death resulting from bodily injury due accident only (for Defence: under civilian condition (off duty) )
- Accidental Death resulting from bodily injury which directly and independently of all other causes results in Death within twelve (12) months of the event date
- On the event date, the account holder
- Is a bonafide employees (aged less than 70 years ) of the organization to whom the specific offer has been extended
- Is holding a Salary Account under the Corporate Salary Account Program with M&N Bank and has received salary credit in the month or month prior
- Should have carried out at least one purchase transaction using the Debit Card, within 6 months prior to the date of loss.
- In case of Air Accidental Death claim ticket should have been purchased using Debit Card linked to Salary Account
Cover provided only to the primary account holder

patterns: What do I need to do to open a joint account

Requirements for opening a joint account
responses: The Reimbursement Account has to be in the same order as your Salary Savings Account.
In case your Salary savings account is a joint account then a separate introduction is not required and you only need to add the name in the (Account Opening Document) AOD.

patterns: Will I be able to access both my accounts at all establishments/ATMs through a single Debit Card
Accessing multiple accounts through a single Debit Card
Debit Card access to multiple accounts
responses: Your existing Debit Card will be linked to both accounts.
Any additional card will be charged at the regular rates.
You will be able to select either account to transact at M&N Bank ATMs.
At other VISA/PLUS ATMs (Other Bank’s ATMs) you may or may not have access to both accounts.
When such an option is unavailable, you can only access your salary account.
If you are a VISA Electron Debit Cardholder you can access only your Salary Account at merchant locations for transactions and not your Reimbursement Account.
If you are a Maestro Debit Cardholder may be able to select between your Salary Account and Reimbursement Account at merchant locations.

patterns: Will I earn interest on the Reimbursement Account

responses: The Reimbursement Account is a value-added benefit given to the salary account holder and hence is a non-interest-bearing account.

responses: A Reimbursement Account enables you to separate your regular monthly salary from the monthly reimbursements you receive from your company.
This helps you track reimbursements separately.

patterns: How can I stop a cheque payment

responses: To make a Stop Payment request on an issued Cheque, kindly follow the steps mentioned below:
- Log in to your NetBanking account

- Select the Account Number (if more than 1 account)

Stop payment of cheques through NetBanking is free of charge.
You may obtain the cheque series from PhoneBanking and then use NetBanking to stop the cheques.
Alternatively, you could use PhoneBanking or the branch to make a Stop Payment request for a cheque.
Read more about fees and charges applicable to stop cheques [here](fees-and-charges-link).

patterns: What is the rate of interest I will earn on the balance in my Savings Account
responses: Interest on a Savings Account is paid at 4.00% p.a. on a daily end of day balance, w.e.f. May 3, 2011.

patterns: What happens if I don't use my savings account for a very long time
responses: The account becomes dormant if there are no customer-initiated transactions (excludes system-generated transactions like credit interest, debit interest) in the account for a continuous period of two years. patterns: How do I register for Email Statement/s
responses:
To register for an Email Statement of your Account, follow these steps:
Step 1) Log in to Net Banking
Step 2) On the left-hand menu under 'Request,' click on 'Email Statement Registration'
Step 3) After reading the Terms and Conditions, tick on the text box and then click on 'Continue' and then 'Confirm'
Alternatively, submit the attached form to your nearest branch to register for the email statement facility. If unable to visit a branch, send the form by post or courier.
Note/Important: Email statements are currently free of charge. Dispatch of physical statements will discontinue once you register for the Email Statement. For Savings Account Customers, only the Primary Account holder will be eligible for the Email Statement facility. If you are a secondary account holder, you will not receive any Email Statements. For Current Account Holders, only a Sole Current Account holder can avail of this registration facility. For Managed Customers, Combined Email Statements for all accounts linked to the Primary Customer ID will be provided across Savings and Current Accounts and Fixed Deposits. For any other queries or to know the status of an existing application, please call up PhoneBanking or write to us mentioning the details given below:
M&N Bank Branch/mode where your request was submitted
Date when your request was submitted

patterns: How do I update my PAN number
responses:
To update your PAN number, follow either of the following procedures mentioned below:
1) Request through branch:
Step 1) Submit a written request specifying your updated PAN number.
Step 2) Give a self-attested photocopy of your PAN card (carry originals for verification).
2) Request through Netbanking:
PAN can be updated online from your NetBanking. Follow the steps below:
- Log in to NetBanking with your Customer Identification Number and NetBanking Password (IPIN).
- Click on 'Contact details' on the top right-hand corner & Select Edit Pan number / Click on 'Add/Update PAN number' on the Accounts tabs.
- Update your 10 digit PAN.
- Click on Confirm.
Note: The submitted PAN will be updated within 5 working days, post validation of the PAN with the income tax records.

patterns: Reissuance of ATM/Debit Card PIN
responses:

patterns: How can I change/update the address for my account
responses:
To update/change your address, follow the below steps:
1) Personally Visit your nearest Branch or
2) Send your request through courier, Post, or Bearer to the nearest branch:
   - Click here to download the form or Fill the application form available at the Branch.
   - The application form needs to be duly filled and signed by the account holder.
   - Attach a copy of Address proof to the address change request.
   - If you are visiting the Branch, carry your original documentation for verification.
   - If you are sending the request through post, attach a copy of self-attested address proof.
Your mailing address will be updated within 7 working days after receipt of complete documentation. Joint account holders need to fill a separate request for address change. You may view the updated address by logging on to NetBanking under My Contact Details.

patterns: How do I activate a 'Dormant' Savings Account
responses:
To activate your account, follow the steps below:
Step 1) Approach the branch in person.
Step 2) Submit a written request for activation of your dormant account, signed as per operating instructions in the account.
Step 3) Furnish proof of identity and Address (carry the original for verification).
Step 4) Initiate a transaction, and your account will be activated once again.

patterns: How Do I Change/Add my Mobile Number
responses:
To change your Mobile Number, follow the procedure below:
Step 1) Fill the application form available at the Branch (duly signed by all the holders).
Step 2) If you are unable to visit an M&N Bank Branch, you can send the form by post or courier.
Note/Important: Instruction received through Net Banking, or scan copy, fax, or email will not be processed for security and authentication purpose. Updates for InstaAlerts and / or Mobile Banking (if registered) need to be done separately.
InstaAlerts Updates: Submit your requirement at your nearest branch, through a written letter duly signed by all account holders. If you are unable to visit a branch, you can send the letter by post or courier.
Mobile Banking Updates/InstaQuery Updates: Cancel InstaQuery on your old number and then re-register for InstaQuery on your new number by following the process mentioned below:
- Log in to Net Banking with your Customer Identification Number and NetBanking Password (IPIN).
- Click on InstaQuery Registration on the top right-hand corner.
- Select De-register for InstaQuery from the left-hand side menu.
- From the list shown, select the mobile number that needs to be de-registered.
- Click on 'Continue.'
- Select 'Confirm.'
Your InstaQuery de-registration request will be processed online. Subsequently, re-register for InstaQuery on the new number as below:
- Log in to NetBanking with your Customer Identification Number and NetBanking Password (IPIN).
- Click on InstaQuery Registration on the top right-hand corner.
- Select Subscribe for InstaQuery from the left-hand side menu.
- Choose your Account Number from the list of all accounts linked to your Customer Identification number.
- Provide your 10 digit mobile number along with the country code.
- Click on the Check box which states 'I accept Terms and Conditions.'
- Click on 'Confirm.'
Your request will be processed online.

FD
Can I use e-Monies NEFT for foreign remittances
responses: This is a service designed only for remitting Indian Rupees within India.

patterns: Is the e-Monies NEFT system better than the existing RBI-EFT system
responses: E-Monies NEFT has no restrictions, because it's based on a centralized network. That's not the case for the RBI-EFT system, which is confined to just 15 centres.

patterns: What information is required to use the e-monies NEFT service
responses: To use this service, you should provide the beneficiary details (name and account number), and the name and IFSC of the beneficiary bank branch.

patterns: If the money is not credited to the beneficiary's account while using the e-monies NEFT service, will I get it back
responses: Your funds will be returned to your account if they are not credited.

patterns: How does the e-monies NEFT service differ from RGTS and EFT
responses: E-Monies NEFT is an electronic payment system, used to transfer funds to any part of India. It works on 'net settlement', unlike RTGS that works on 'gross settlement', and EFT which is restricted to only 15 centres.

patterns: What are the charges for the e-monies National Electronic Funds Transfer service
responses:
NEFT transactions on NetBanking are charged as below:
Amounts up to Rs. 10,000 - Rs.2.5 (exclusive of taxes) per transaction
Amounts from Rs.10,001 to Rs.1 lakh - Rs. 5 (exclusive of taxes) per transaction
Amounts above Rs. 1 lakh up to Rs. 2 lakh - Rs. 15 (exclusive of taxes) per transaction
Amounts above Rs.2 lakh – Rs.25 (exclusive of taxes) per transaction

patterns: How do I check the IFSC of the receiving branch
responses: Just ask your beneficiary to get the IFSC from his or her branch. They can also find it in their cheque book - the IFSC is in the cheque leaf.

patterns: How is RTGS different from National Electronic Funds Transfer (NEFT)
responses: NEFT is an electronic fund transfer system that operates on a deferred net settlement (DNS) basis, which settles transactions in batches. In DNS, the settlement takes place at a definite time and all transactions are held up till that instant. RTGS is different because transactions are processed continuously.

patterns: What is RTGS Funds Transfer
responses: 'RTGS' stands for 'Real Time Gross Settlement'. The RTGS system is a funds transfer mechanism where transfer of money takes place from one bank to another on a 'real time' and on a 'gross' basis. This is the fastest possible money transfer system through banking channels. 'Real time' means no waiting period; transactions are settled as soon as they are processed. 'Gross settlement' means the transaction is finalized on its own, without it being bunched with any other transaction.

patterns: Are there minimum or maximum limits for RTGS transfers
responses: The RTGS system has been designed for large value transactions. The minimum amount to be remitted through RTGS is Rs. 2 Lakhs. There is no upper ceiling for RTGS transactions. The only change to this is RTGS transactions done through NetBanking, when the maximum amount of funds that can be transferred per Customer ID per day is Rs. 10 Lakhs.

patterns: What information do I need to provide when using the RTGS funds transfer service
responses:
When using RTGS Funds Transfers, there are a few essential details to provide:
Amount to be remitted
Account number from where the funds will be debited
Name of the beneficiary bank, and the name of the beneficiary customer
Account number of the beneficiary customer
Sender to receiver information, if there is one
The IFSC code of the receiving branch

patterns: What are the charges for the RTGS funds transfer service
responses:
Effective 15 November, 2010; RTGS transactions on NetBanking are charged as below :
Rs. 2 lac to Rs. 5 lac - Rs. 25 (inclusive of taxes) per transaction
Above Rs. 5 lac - Rs. 50 (inclusive of taxes) per transaction
Note: RTGS transfers can be done for amounts exceeding Rs. 2,00,000 only whereas for NEFT there are no such amount restrictions.

patterns: How long does it take for funds to be transferred from one account to another
responses: Real-time means that beneficiary branches are expected to receive the funds as soon as they are transferred by the remitting bank. The beneficiary bank must credit the beneficiary's account within 30 minutes of receiving the funds transfer message.

patterns: If the money is not credited successfully, will the remitting customer get the funds back
responses: With RTGS, the receiving bank should credit the account of the beneficiary instantly. If for some reason the money cannot be credited, the receiving bank has to return the money to the remitting bank within 1 hour. As soon as the money is returned, the original debit entry in the customer's account is reversed.

patterns: What do you mean by exclusions under the Accidental Protection Plan - Hospital Cash
responses: Exclusions are situations or conditions where M&N ERGO is not liable to pay the benefits to the insured person in the event of an accident.

patterns: Can I include my spouse in the Accidental Protection Plan - Hospital Cash policy
responses: Yes, you can include your spouse and up to 2 children in the policy.

patterns: How do I make a claim
responses: You can make a claim by calling our toll-free number 1800-226-226 (MTNL or BSNL) or 1800-2-700-700 (any line) or 022 6638 4800 (local/STD charges apply). We will then assist you with the submission of the documents required and the process will be completed within 7 working days, once all the required documents are submitted.

patterns: When does my Revive Policy for Personal Accident start
responses: It will commence within 15 days from the date of receipt of the form and premium payment.

patterns: What plans are available under the Revive Policy for Personal Accident
responses: M&N ERGO offers a wide range of sums insured ranging from Rs. 2.5 Lakhs to Rs. 15 Lakhs, with four plan options to choose from: Self Plan, Self and Family Plan, Self + Dependent Parents Add-On, Self and Family + Dependent Parents Add-On.

patterns: What benefit do I get from the Revive Policy for Personal Accident if I break my bones
responses: You get 10% of the sum insured up to Rs. 50,000 (for dependent parents) if you break your bones in an accident.

patterns: Is there an age limit to buy an Accidental Protection Plan - Hospital Cash policy
responses: We can insure anyone between the age of 18 and 69 years.

patterns: Who can be a beneficiary under the Accidental Protection Plan - Hospital Cash
responses: A beneficiary can be any member of your family.

patterns: How do I renew my Accidental Protection Plan - Hospital Cash policy
responses: We will send you renewal reminders. The number of days in advance the reminder is sent depends on the pay plan you have opted for. Pay plan break up: Cheque – 45 days, Credit Card – 60 days.

patterns: Will I get a renewed Revive Policy for Personal Accident policy
responses: Yes, you will receive a renewed policy.

patterns: What is the definition of a dependent child
responses: A dependent child is an unmarried child between the age of 3 months and 18 years, or up to 21 years if in full-time education, residing with the insured person.

patterns: Does the Accidental Protection Plan - Hospital Cash policy cover natural death and daily sickness as well
responses: This policy only covers accidental death.

patterns: Does the Revive Policy for Personal Accident cover natural death and daily sickness
responses: This policy only covers accidental death.

patterns: What benefit do I get from the Accidental Protection Plan - Hospital Cash policy if I break my bones
responses: You will be paid up to Rs. 50,000 if you break your bones in an accident.

patterns: How do I make my premium payments for my Accidental Protection Plan - Hospital Cash policy
responses: This is an annual policy where the premium can be made online via Credit Card, NetBanking, or Cheque.

patterns: What is an accident
responses: An accident is any sudden or unexpected event, which leads to permanent physical disability or accidental death.

patterns: When does my Accidental Protection Plan - Hospital Cash policy start
responses: Your policy will commence within 15 days from the date of receipt of the form and premium payment.

patterns: What is the definition of a dependent child
responses: A dependent child is an unmarried child between the age of 3 months and 18 years, or up to 21 years if in full-time education, residing with the insured person.

patterns: Does the Accidental Protection Plan - Hospital Cash policy have a hospital cash benefit
responses: Yes, hospital cash provides a benefit of Rs. 1,000 for every day up to a maximum of 30 days in case of hospitalization due to an accident.

patterns: What is the cancellation procedure
responses: The policy can be canceled with a notice period of 30 days. The premium paid by you will be returned on a pro-rata basis or 25% of the annual premium, whichever is higher will be retained. Any cancellation request sent after 30 days of commencement of the policy will be refunded on a pro-rata basis.

patterns: Does the Revive Policy for Personal Accident have a hospital cash benefit
responses: Yes, hospital cash provides a benefit of Rs. 250 every day up to a maximum of 30 days in case of hospitalization due to an accident.

patterns: What do you mean by exclusions under the Revive Policy for Personal Accident
responses: Exclusions are situations or conditions where M&N ERGO is not liable to pay the benefits to the insured person in the event of an accident.

patterns: How many members can be included under the Family Plan of the Revive Policy for Personal Accident
responses: You can include your spouse and up to 2 children under the Family Plan.

patterns: Is there an age limit to opt for a Revive Policy for Personal Accident
responses: A Revive Policy is open to anyone between the age of 18 and 65 years.

patterns: Why should I purchase Critical Illness Insurance
responses: Critical Illness Insurance provides you and your family with additional financial security on the diagnosis of a critical illness. The policy provides a lump sum amount which could be used for: Cost of care and treatment Recuperation aids Pay off of debts Any loss in income owing to a decrease in ability to earn View more

patterns: What is Critical Illness Insurance
responses: Critical Illness Insurance is a policy that pays out a lump sum amount up to the sum insured upon diagnosis of a critical illness covered under the policy.

patterns: Can I make multiple claims for the same or any other listed Critical Illness
responses: No, you can make only one claim during the lifetime of the policy.

patterns: What is meant by disease under the Critical Illness - Platinum Plan
responses: Disease is a pathological condition of a part, organ or system resulting from various causes such as infection, pathological process or environmental stress and characterized by an identifiable group of signs or symptoms.

patterns: What are the available plans under the Critical Illness policy
responses: You can choose to be insured for any of the following amounts: Rs. 2,50,000, Rs. 5,00,000, Rs.7,50,000 or Rs. 10,00,000.

patterns: Who do I contact in the case of a claim under the Critical Illness policy
responses: In the case of a claim under the policy, you should immediately intimate us on our helpline number. On receipt of the intimation, we will register the claim and assign a unique claim reference number which will be communicated to the insured and may be used for all future correspondence.

patterns: What are the benefits under the Critical Illness - Platinum Plan
responses: The company will pay the sum insured as a lump sum on the first diagnosis of any one of the following critical illnesses, provided that the insured person survives a period of 30 days from the date of the first diagnosis. The following critical illnesses are covered under our plan: Heart Attack (Myocardial Infarction ) Coronary Artery Bypass Surgery Stroke Cancer Kidney Failure Major Organ Transplant Multiple Sclerosis Paralysis View more

patterns: What do you mean by pre-existing diseases not covered under the Critical Illness plan
responses: A pre-existing disease is any condition, ailment, injury or related condition for which the insured person had signs or symptoms and/or was diagnosed and/or received medical advice or treatment prior to the first policy with the company.

patterns: What is cumulative bonus
responses: Cumulative bonus is an increase in the sum insured by a specified percentage of every claim-free year subject to a certain maximum, provided that the policy is renewed without any break. Under the Health Suraksha policy, you can avail a 5% cumulative bonus for every claim-free year up to 50% of SI.

patterns: What is meant by Day Care Procedures
responses: Day Care Procedures are the medical procedures/surgeries wherein the person does not need to be hospitalized for more than 24 hours due to technological advancement.

patterns: What are Pre and Post hospitalization expenses
responses: Pre-hospitalization expenses mean medical expenses incurred for a specified number of days prior to hospitalization for any disease, illness or injury sustained which is covered under the Policy. Post-hospitalization expenses mean medical expenses incurred for a specified number of days after discharge from the hospital. In 'Health Suraksha' the pre-hospitalization period is 60 days while the post-hospitalization period is 90 days.

patterns: What are the benefits of a health card
responses: A health card mentions the contact details and contact numbers of the TPA. In case of a medical emergency, you can call these numbers for queries, clarifications, or to seek any kind of assistance. Moreover, you need to display your health card at the time of admission into the hospital.

patterns: Do I need to pay for hospitalization
responses: If you are admitted to any of our network hospitals, you can avail a cashless facility. We will directly reimburse all the admissible expenses to the hospital. However, in case of non-network hospitals, you will have to settle hospital bills at the time of discharge and consequently, the same will be reimbursed to you by us.

patterns: What is Family Floater and what are its features
responses: Family Floater is a policy wherein the entire family of the insured comprising of the insured and his/her dependents, are covered under a single sum insured. The advantages of such a policy are: All members of the family (as defined above) can be covered under one policy. A Single Premium is payable for the entire family The amount of the sum insured floats over the entire family, i.e. the limit can be used by any member of the family, any number of times. You do not have to keep track of renewals for different members. Just a single renewal date has to be remembered. View more

patterns: What is the difference between fixed benefit health insurance plans and reimbursement health insurance plans
Fixed benefit vs Reimbursement health insurance
Insurance plan comparison
responses: Fixed benefit plans cover the risk associated with a rare critical illness and provide predetermined sum insured upon diagnosis of few covered conditions. Payment under fixed benefit plans is usually made upon diagnosis and is not linked to the medical expense that the life insured may incur for treatment of such condition. Such plans help one to compensate for loss of income that arises due to long period of treatment and recuperation that may be required. Such policies pay the benefits only once and then the cover ceases. Reimbursement plans provide for reimbursement of actual medical expenses incurred in a hospital. These medical expenses could range from low amounts incurred in treatment of common ailments like malaria or dengue to significant expenses incurred in treatment of critical illnesses. Such policies do not cease on payment of claim once and continue to pay the claims every year subject to continuous renewals. View more

patterns: What happens if Premiums are not paid
Non-payment of premiums consequences
Insurance plan premium payment default
responses: This plan has a grace period of 30 days. You are expected to pay your annual premium throughout the policy term. Discontinuance before completion of 5 years from commencement of the policy: If you have not paid your premium by the expiry of the grace period, then you will have the following options: To revive the policy within a period of 2 years from the date of discontinuance, or To completely withdraw from the policy without any risk cover. Your policy will be discontinued if: You do not exercise any of the above-mentioned options, or You choose to completely withdraw from the policy without any risk cover. Until the discontinuance of the policy, the risk cover will remain in-force, and policy charges will continue to be deducted. Once the policy is discontinued, the risk cover will cease, and the fund value (as on the date of discontinuance) less the applicable Discontinuance Charge (Please see the Charges section for details of the Discontinuance Charges) will be moved to the 'Discontinued Policy Fund'. The minimum guaranteed interest rate applicable to the 'Discontinued Policy Fund' shall be 4% p.a. Such rate may be changed in the future if the IRDA revises the minimum rate for discontinued policies. The Discontinued Policy Fund (SFIN: ULIF05110/03/11DiscontdPF101) shall be a unit fund that will invest 100% of assets in Government Securities and/or Money Market Instruments. Any excess income earned in the discontinued fund over and above the minimum guaranteed interest rate shall also be apportioned to the 'Discontinued Policy Fund'. A Fund Management Charge of 0.50% p.a. will be levied for amounts in the 'Discontinued Policy Fund'. If a discontinued policy is not revived, the proceeds will be paid out upon the completion of the lock-in period of five years. In instances where the revival period is not completed at the end of the lock-in period, the policyholder can opt to receive the proceeds either upon the completion of the lock-in period or upon the completion of the revival period. If, in such cases, the policyholder does not exercise any option, then the proceeds will be paid upon the completion of the lock-in period. After the payment of the discontinuance benefit, the policy shall terminate, and no further benefits shall be payable under the policy. View more
