responses: This is an annual policy, where the premium can be made via Credit Card or Cheque.

patterns: What is an accident
responses: Accident means a sudden, unforeseen and involuntary event caused by external, visible & violent means.

patterns: Is there an age limit for opting M&N Ergo Personal Accident Insurance policy
responses: Personal Accident Insurance is open to everyone from the age of 18 years to 65 years.

patterns: Till what age the M&N Ergo Personal Accident Insurance policy can be renewed
responses: Personal Accident Insurance policy can be renewed for life long

patterns: What do you mean by exclusions
responses: Exclusions are situations or conditions where in M&N ERGO is not liable to pay the benefits to the insured person in the event of an accident.

patterns: Does this policy cover natural death and daily sickness also
responses: This policy only covers accidental death.

patterns: Who can be the beneficiary
responses: The beneficiary could be any member of your family.

patterns: Will my accident policy cover me even if I am out of the country
responses: Yes the accident policy will cover you even if you are out of the country. The sum insured will be paid to you in Indian Rupees in case of a claim i.e. the claim will be paid out in India only.

patterns: Does the threshold/deductible limit consist of single claim or multiple claims
responses: Threshold/ deductable limit is an aggregate deductible which the customer has to pay either from his pocket or through other Mediclaim, beyond aggregate deductible (crossed in single claim or in multiple claims in a policy year) full claim amount will be paid by M&N Ergo General Insurance.

patterns: Is there any co-payment applied on this policy
responses: All person(s) named covered under the policy above the age of 80 years (age last birthday) shall bear a co-pay of 10% for each and every claim.

patterns: Do I need to undergo a medical test for buying this policy
responses: You are not required to undergo any medical tests up to the age of 55 years, except if you have declared any pre-existing diseases or ailments at the time of applying for the policy. In such cases and for applicants above age 55 years, one has to undergo the specified medical tests.

patterns: What are the Medical test charges
responses: Pre agreed charges for health check up with our network provider are Rs 1000/- and Rs.1200/- per person for SET1 & SET2 respectively. On acceptance of proposals, we will reimburse 50% of the expenses.

patterns: What is the minimum and maximum deductible in this plan
responses: You can choose a minimum of Rs. 2,00,000 and a maximum of Rs. 5,00,000 aggregate deductible in this policy.

patterns: What is the entry & exit age for this policy
responses: One can be a proposer under the Policy from the age of 18 years to 65 years. You can insure your children from the age of 91 days to the age of 23 years.

patterns: Can I also include my parents and parent-in-laws in this policy
responses: Yes, you can include your parents and parent-in-laws in the same Policy on an Individual Sum Insured basis and in a separate Policy on floater Sum Insured basis.

patterns: Is it mandatory to inform change in health condition in writing while renewing Super Top Up plan
responses: No. There is no such obligation under the Policy. Once we have accepted the proposal, the member will be eligible for a lifetime renewal.

patterns: If the claim amount is 6 lakhs, how much will be paid by M&N Ergo General Insurance
responses: Whatever is over and above the threshold limit will be paid.

patterns: What are the documents required
responses: Please refer to the Policy wordings for an exhaustive list of claims documents required. We will not ask for anything over and above the list given in the Policy.

patterns: Will the continuity benefit (2 years) be given on Super Top Up plan as well
responses: Continuity benefit will not be available in Super Top Up plan as portability benefits are not available in this product.

patterns: Does the pre-existing cover start after 4 years or 3 years
responses: The Policy covers expenses incurred for the treatment of diseases that you have before taking the Policy. Such will be covered only after 36 months of continuous coverage.

patterns: Chemo & dialysis does not require local or general anesthesia; will it be covered under day care
responses: Yes, since chemo & dialysis are recurring procedures and do not require local or general anesthesia, in this context, all such procedures will be covered & paid under day care procedures.

patterns: Do we have any loading on pre-existing ailments
responses: Yes, there will be loading on pre-existing ailments which will be arrived at after health check-up of the customer. Acceptance of the proposal will be subject to medical underwriting.

patterns: A person undergoes dialysis 4 times a week; will it be covered if the basic deductible is exhausted
responses: Yes, any illness payable under the Policy for which the threshold gets exhausted will be paid under Super top-up.

patterns: Can I cover my family members in this policy
responses: You can cover your family members as given below in a single Policy on Individual Sum Insured basis. Brother, Sister, Grand Son, Grand Daughter, Daughter in Law, Son in Law, Nephew, Niece, Grand Mother, and Grand Father.

patterns: Will I get tax benefit if I cover my family on an individual Sum Insured basis
responses: Yes, you will get a Tax benefit under section 80D.

patterns: What will be the start date of my insurance policy
responses: Your insurance cover starts from the commencement date indicated by you in the proposal form or receipt of the premium by us, whichever is later.

patterns: If I have a home insurance policy with two different companies, will I benefit from both
responses: If you have a policy with two insurance companies, at the time of the claim, both insurance companies will pay on a proportionate basis.

patterns: Is there an age limit on the property for it to be insured
responses: No, there is no age limit to buy a home insurance policy.

patterns: What are the documents required to be submitted in case of a home burglary claim
responses: The original invoice has to be submitted, giving the value of the items stolen. In addition to this, you also have to give the replacement cost/repair cost, FIR, Final police report, and claim form.

patterns: What happens to the home insurance policy if the insured house is sold
responses: From the time the transfer of ownership becomes effective, the policy stands cancelled, and the insured ceases to be an insured under the policy. We will then refund the premium for the balance of the insured period.

patterns: What is the difference between burglary, theft, and larceny
responses: Burglary is when there is forceful entry into the premises in order to rob. Theft is when there is a robbery without any evidence of forceful entry into the premises. Larceny is when a known person on the premises has robbed or stolen the insured's belongings.

patterns: Can a HUF/ Leased (Mhada/Cidco) property be insured
responses: If you have a financial interest in the property as owner or lessor, then you can insure the property.

patterns: Can the plan be offered under limited underwriting
Limited underwriting option in the plan
Insurance plan underwriting details
responses: The plan can be applied by filing in the Short Medical Questionnaire (SMQ), which may not require you to go for medicals.

patterns: What is the Death-Benefit under the plan
Insurance plan death benefit
Policy death benefit details
responses: On death during the policy term, provided the policy is in force, the nominee will receive the higher of the following: Sum Assured 10 times the Annualized Premium* 105% of the premiums* paid till date In addition to the above, accrued guaranteed additions would be payable on death. *The Premium amount excludes any underwriting extra premiums and any taxes paid. On payment of the Death Benefit, the policy will terminate, and no more benefits will be payable. View more

patterns: When does the plan acquire Guaranteed Surrender value
Insurance plan Guaranteed Surrender value
Policy surrender value details
responses: The policy will acquire a Guaranteed Surrender Value (GSV) provided 2 full yearsÃ¢â¬â¢ premium has been paid for the premium payment term of 7 years and 3 full yearsÃ¢â¬â¢ premium have been paid for the premium payment term of 10 years or more.

patterns: What is the premium frequency available under policy
Premium frequency options in the policy
Insurance plan premium payment frequency
responses: The premiums can be paid annually, half-yearly, quarterly, and annually.

patterns: What security do I need to provide to obtain a Business loan
Security for business loan
Collateral for business loan
responses: To obtain the loan, there is absolutely no need to provide any security or collateral.

patterns: What are the benefits of having a Current/Saving Account for my Business loan
Benefits of having an account for business loan
Business loan account advantages
responses: You get preferred Processing Fee, priority processing, and simpler documentation if you have a Current/Saving Account with M&N Bank. This is taken into account at the time of disbursal of the loan. You can pay through Standing Instructions to debit your M&N Bank Account with the EMI amount.

patterns: How long will it take for me to get a Business Loan
Business loan approval duration
Loan processing time for business loan
responses: Once you submit your application form and supporting documents, we shall give approval within 5 working days provided everything is in order. All loan approvals are at the sole discretion of the bank.

patterns: Can I repay the loan earlier for Business Loan
Early repayment of business loan
Foreclosure of business loan
responses: Yes, you can choose to repay your loan anytime after 6 months of taking the loan and after you have paid 06 EMIs along with applicable foreclosure charges. Please note Loan can be foreclosed by issuing a Demand draft / cheque at the branch; kindly note that cash beyond Rs. 49000/- will not be accepted for loan repayment against full closure/matured loan closure payment. Any payment above Rs. 49000/- should be made vide Account payee Cheque / Pay order /Demand draft.

patterns: How can I get my address changed in my loan account
Changing address in loan account
Address update for loan account
responses: In order to change your address in our records, you may visit the nearest Retail Loan Service Center and submit the following documents: Request form for Address Change. Self Attested copy of your revised address proof along with the original address proof for validation. In case a bearer submits the request on your behalf, a bearer authorization along with KYC documents(self-attested copy and original for validation) of the bearer, i.e. Identity and Signature Proof like PAN Card, Aadhar Card, Driving License or Passport Copy will also need to be provided.

patterns: What will be done with the post-dated cheques if I request to change the mode of repayment/ account for my loan
Post-dated cheques for changed loan repayment
Handling of cheques for modified loan repayment
responses: Post Dated Cheques(PDCs)/Security Cheques submitted towards loan repayment that have not been encashed, will be defaced and retained by the Bank. In case, you wish to have your old Post Dated Cheques(PDCs)/ Security Cheques to be returned to you, kindly lodge a request at the Retail Loan Service Center or through PhoneBanking or write us an email at www.M&N bank.com/services within 45 days from the date of application of change in repayment instructions. In case, we do not hear from you within the stipulated period, the defaced cheques will be destroyed.

patterns: What are the charges I have to pay to change the mode of repayment/ account for my loan
Charges for changing loan repayment instructions
Loan repayment mode change fees
responses: A service charge of Rs.500 is applicable for changes in loan repayment instructions issued from non-M&N Bank Account (ECS or PDC facility). A cheque/pay order/demand draft for Rs. 500 favoring M&N Bank Ltd Loan Account No. << >> will be required along with the revised set of repayment instructions.

patterns: How can I change the mode of repayment/ account for my loan
Changing loan repayment mode
Loan repayment instructions modification
responses: In the event that you wish to change the mode of repayment/bank account for your loan repayment, you may visit the nearest Retail Loan Service Center and submit your request with the revised account mandate/instructions. You can opt to repay through alternate repayment instructions as follows: 1) Standing Instructions: We offer the Standing Instructions (SI) facility whereby we can directly debit your M&N Bank account for EMI amounts on due dates. Please submit the following at your nearest Retail Loan Service Center: Request form for swap of repayment instructions. 3 Security cheques favoring M&N Bank Ltd Loan Account No. << >>, each undated and filled with a value equal to the sum of 3 EMIs. SI mandate duly filled and verified by M&N Bank. In case a bearer submits the request on your behalf, a bearer authorization along with KYC documents(self-attested copy and original for validation) of the bearer, i.e. Identity and Signature Proof like PAN Card, Aadhar Card, Driving License or Passport Copy will also need to be provided. 2) Electronic Clearing Service (ECS): We offer the ECS facility whereby we can directly debit your non-M&N Bank account for EMI amounts on due dates. Please submit the following at your nearest Retail Loan Service Center: Request form for swap of repayment instructions. Security cheques favoring M&N Bank Ltd Loan Account No. << >>*** ECS mandate duly filled and verified by your banker. ACH(Automated Clearing House) Mandate. Swap Charges of Rs.500/- favoring M&N Bank Ltd Loan Account No. << >> In case a bearer submits the request on your behalf, a bearer authorization along with KYC documents(self-attested copy and original for validation) of the bearer, i.e. Identity and Signature Proof like PAN Card, Aadhar Card, Driving License or Passport Copy will also need to be provided. ***Security Cheques: You need to issue 1 security cheque for every 6 Equated Monthly Installments (EMI). The amount on each security undated cheque should be equal to the sum of 3 EMIs. For example, if your EMI amount is Rs. 1000 and you have paid 18 EMIs for a 36 month loan tenure, you need to submit 3 Security Cheques of Rs. 3000 each. 3) Post-dated Cheques (This mode is allowed only if the location is non ECS): Please submit the following documents at your nearest Retail Loan Service Center: Request form for swap of repayment instructions Revised post dated cheques in favour of M&N Bank Ltd Loan Account No. << >> for the balance EMIs. ACH(Automated Clearing House) Mandate Swap Charges of Rs.500/- favoring M&N Bank Ltd Loan Account No. << >> In case a bearer submits the request on your behalf, a bearer authorization along with KYC documents(self-attested copy and original for validation) of the bearer, i.e. Identity and Signature Proof like PAN Card, Aadhar Card, Driving License or Passport Copy will also need to be provided.

patterns: How do I obtain a Duplicate Repayment Schedule for my loan account
Duplicate Repayment Schedule for loan
Loan account repayment schedule copy
responses: You may obtain a Duplicate Repayment Schedule for your loan account, free of charge by registering for our NetBanking facility on www.M&N bank.com and download the repayment schedule for your linked loan account. Alternatively, you may visit the nearest Retail Loan Service Center and submit the following documents Request form for Duplicate Repayment Schedule. Duplicate Repayment Schedule Charges of Rs.200/- favoring M&N Bank Ltd Loan Account No. << >> In case a bearer submits the request on your behalf, a bearer authorization along with KYC documents(self-attested copy and original for validation) of the bearer, i.e. Identity and Signature Proof like PAN Card, Aadhar Card, Driving License or Passport Copy will also need to be provided.

patterns: How much loan can I avail of Business Loan
Business Loan eligibility amount
Maximum loan for Business Loan
responses: You can avail of a loan from Rs 50,000/- to Rs 50,00,000/- depending on your income, repayment capacity and respective location product cap.

patterns: How do I repay my Business Loan
Business Loan repayment process
Repayment methods for Business Loan
responses: You pay the loan in equal monthly instalments (EMIs). The loan will be paid through post-dated cheques. You can also pay through Electronic Clearing System (ECS ) or a standing instruction to debit your M&N Bank account with the EMI amount.

patterns: What are the loan tenure options for Business Loan
Business Loan tenure choices
Loan duration for Business Loan
responses: You can repay your loan over a period of 12 to 48 months.

patterns: Do I need to pledge anything or give collateral to get a car loan
Collateral for car loan
Car loan pledge requirements
responses: No, there’s no need for any collateral. You will only need you to hypothecate the car in our name. An endorsement will have to be made in the Registration Certificate (RC) book of the vehicle. This will be cancelled after you repay the loan.

patterns: How long can the tenure of my loan be
Loan tenure for Auto Loan
Auto Loan duration
responses: Usually, the tenure of an Auto Loan is 3 to 7 years. The tenure also depends on the type of car you wish to purchase. If it is a super premium car, the tenure is restricted to 3 years only. In addition, the higher your tenure is the lower your EMI will be, but the total interest outflow is higher.

patterns: What documents do I need to submit after the loan amount is disbursed
Post loan disbursal document submission
Loan disbursement document requirements
responses: You can keep the original car documents, registration certificate, insurance policy and tax papers with you; but you need to submit photocopies of these documents to the bank.

patterns: What happens if the car meets with an accident
Car loan accident procedure
Loan process in case of car accident
responses: In the event of an accident, the first step is to inform the insurance company. The company then sends a surveyor to assess the extent of damages to the car. Your claim is then processed and paid directly to us, unless you have taken an NOC from the bank in which case the payment will be made by the insurance company in your favour. The bank normally gives you an NOC if you are regular in your payments. In case of a complete loss, the bank will receive the payment directly from the insurance company.

patterns: Can I get finance for insurance and registration
Insurance and registration finance for car loan
Financing for insurance and registration
responses: No. The ex-showroom price is considered which does not cover insurance and registration charges.

patterns: How much loan can I get
Loan amount eligibility
Maximum loan amount
responses: The amount of the loan you can get depends on: The cost of the vehicle, The type of vehicle (standard/premium), The percentage of finance offered.

patterns: Can I sell my car before I repay my loan
Selling car before loan repayment
Car sale before loan settlement
responses: No, you cannot sell your car unless you repay your loan. An NOC is required from the financier before you can sell your car.

patterns: How much time will it take to change the mode of repayment/ account to repay my loan
Loan repayment mode change duration
Time to change loan repayment account
responses: It will take 25 working days to activate the revised instructions. In case your next instalment falls due prior to the 25 day period, instructions already lodged with us will be presented for payment.

patterns: What is De-pledge
Definition of De-pledge
De-pledge explanation
responses: Removal of a pledge from the security to regain the rights over the security is called de-pledge. *Conditions Apply

patterns: What is Guarantor
Guarantor definition
Explanation of Guarantor
responses: A Guarantor is a person who guarantees to pay for someone else's debt if he or she should default on a loan obligation.
